qas.question: Ministers of what faith were trained by the university in early years?
After what higher learning model was the school designed?
Was the school officially associated with any denomination?

answers.text: It was never affiliated with any particular denomination

qas.question: What group was trained at Cambridge in 1643?
In what year was Cambridge founded?

plausible_answers.text: to advance learning and perpetuate it to posterity

qas.question: What was the purpose of Cambridge when it was founded in 1643?
What profession did many graduates of Cambridge become in 1643?
What churches were the graduates of Cambridge affiliated with after 1643?

context: In the early years the College trained many <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b3_0>Puritan<a0_2/><a0_1/> ministers<b3_0/><a0_0/>.[citation needed] (A <b4_0>1643<b4_0/> publication said the school's purpose was "<b5_0>to advance learning and perpetuate it to posterity<b5_0/>, dreading to leave an illiterate ministry to the churches when our present ministers shall lie in the dust".) It offered a classic curriculum on the <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2>English university<a1_2/><a1_1/> model<a1_0/>—​​many leaders in the colony had attended the University of Cambridge—​​but conformed Puritanism. <a2_0>It was <a2_1><a2_2>never<a2_2/><a2_1/> affiliated with any particular denomination<a2_0/>, but many of its earliest graduates went on to become <b6_0>clergymen<b6_0/> in <b7_0>Congregational and Unitarian<b7_0/> churches.
